programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: In a race between a dump truck and a car, man and machine are brought to their limits. Stuntman Stefan receives a load of gravel for his birthday, instead of confetti.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Ferrari California T
programme.desc: The Ferrari California T has a lot of Italian passion and elegant lines to offer. Super sports car cabriolets are popular all over the world. It is no wonder that more and more manufacturers are 'opening up'.

programme.title: BMW Active Hybrid 7
programme.desc: With the Active Hybrid 7, unlike with its predecessor bearing the same model name, BMW now banks on a full hybrid, which can also be driven solely with electric power.

programme.title: Motorstories
programme.desc: Die-hard Porsche fan Marco Wendlandt makes his dream come true: driving a 1984 Porsche 911 coupe. With the help from Big Mike, a car dealer from Los Angeles, he tracks down the car in San Francisco.

programme.title: Motorstories
programme.sub-title: Porsche Outlaw Magnus Walker - Los Angeles
programme.desc: With his newly bought Porsche 911 coupe, Marco heads to L.A. to meet one of the best known Porsche enthusiasts of the world: Magnus Walker, who invites Marco to visit his workshop and his collection.

programme.title: Motorstories
programme.sub-title: Car Tales from California's High Desert
programme.desc: On his way to Las Vegas Marco drops by Big Mike in the Apple Valley. Together they meet Big Mike's friends from the Kustos family, who once used to be trendsetters in the Californian car customizing scene.

programme.title: BMW 503
programme.desc: The noble four-seater 503 convertible was one of BMWs most exclusive models in the 1950s. Many international sports and movie stars and other wealthy customers were fond of this sporty luxury vehicle.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: We present the highlights of last week. The 24 hour race was exciting, as usual. In addition, we explored the 'Strong Man Run' and took a look at the tourist drivers

programme.title: BMW 503
programme.desc: The noble four-seater 503 convertible was one of BMWs most exclusive models in the 1950s. Many international sports and movie stars and other wealthy customers were fond of this sporty luxury vehicle.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Alfa Romeo 6C 2500SS
programme.desc: Founded in 1910, the iconic Italian car manufacturer Alfa Romeo experienced a very eventful history. Their 6C 2500 SS model is right in the middle of the company's more than 100-year history. It combined new technology with an early post-war appearance.

programme.title: Racetrack, Part 16
programme.desc: Today we present the first 3 races of the NASCAR Whelen Euro series.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Touareg receives a comprehensive model update. Gugu drives MG’s electrifying Cyberster in Shanghai and Juliet samples the Toyota Starlet Cross.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We help a Forex trader find perfect the German sports car. Bakkies under the R500 000 compete against each other and we discuss the reliability of a diesel Porsche Panamera

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We kick off the season with sending to George to the Old Car Show. And we kick off our Garage Gold Concourse competition with a Morgan Roadster and a Jaguar XK120.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: We revel in 1950s Americana at the Airlink Adrenaline Air Show. Sbu finds out what car you would buy if money was no object. A BMW M235i is featured in Drag Kings and we witness a couple of daredevils attempt a hair-raising fire tunnel stunt.

programme.title: Auto Union Type C Silver Arrow
programme.desc: Every two years, cars from the past once again roar on the streets of Monte Carlo. The pinnacle of motor sports from back then, the Silver Arrow with 16 cylinders, the Auto Union Type C, still commands the highest respect from drivers today.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Smart offers its iconic city car with a convertible option. The Mini cabriolet is bigger and provides room for four people. When it comes to roadster feeling, the Mazda MX-5 is on top of the list. We took a closer look at these three open-top contenders.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: The Paris Motor Show features the automotive world of tomorrow. In 2016 Mercedes-Benz introduced their “Generation EQ” and Volkswagen announced to build 20 new electrified models by 2020, possibly in order to distract from the emission scandal.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: What would make coupe fans opt for a more traditional two-door model like the Mercedes-Benz E400 instead of its bigger brother, the CLS with four doors? Also: does the Volkswagen Arteon stand a chance against the Mercedes CLS?

programme.title: Arden AJ23
programme.desc: A Jaguar that is able to terrify the world alone with its roar. This Jaguar F-Type R tuned by Arden is a real bad boy. Already in the series production configuration, the F-Type R Coupe is a dream car that can really bite but this Jaguar which has been upgraded from Arden, now calls itself "AJ23“ and is more powerful, louder and more aggressive than any of his brothers.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Touareg receives a comprehensive model update. Gugu drives MG’s electrifying Cyberster in Shanghai and Juliet samples the Toyota Starlet Cross.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We help a Forex trader find perfect the German sports car. Bakkies under the R500 000 compete against each other and we discuss the reliability of a diesel Porsche Panamera

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We kick off the season with sending to George to the Old Car Show. And we kick off our Garage Gold Concourse competition with a Morgan Roadster and a Jaguar XK120.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: We revel in 1950s Americana at the Airlink Adrenaline Air Show. Sbu finds out what car you would buy if money was no object. A BMW M235i is featured in Drag Kings and we witness a couple of daredevils attempt a hair-raising fire tunnel stunt.

programme.title: Auto Union Type C Silver Arrow
programme.desc: Every two years, cars from the past once again roar on the streets of Monte Carlo. The pinnacle of motor sports from back then, the Silver Arrow with 16 cylinders, the Auto Union Type C, still commands the highest respect from drivers today.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: We present the highlights of last week. The 24 hour race was exciting, as usual. In addition, we explored the 'Strong Man Run' and took a look at the tourist drivers

programme.title: BMW 503
programme.desc: The noble four-seater 503 convertible was one of BMWs most exclusive models in the 1950s. Many international sports and movie stars and other wealthy customers were fond of this sporty luxury vehicle.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Alfa Romeo 6C 2500SS
programme.desc: Founded in 1910, the iconic Italian car manufacturer Alfa Romeo experienced a very eventful history. Their 6C 2500 SS model is right in the middle of the company's more than 100-year history. It combined new technology with an early post-war appearance.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: With the GTR, Nissan tried to take on the established European sports car manufacturers. For less than half the price the GTR was a more affordable direct competitor to Porsche's 911 Turbo S or the Audi R8 GT. In addition: one of the ultimate super cars, the Techart 911 Turbo S with 620 hp. And: the Pagani Huayra, presented and driven by Formula 1 Pilot Adrian Sutil.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: It's not always a car's pure power that makes driving through curves exciting. The Subaru BRZ with its low boxer engine and its well-balanced handling gives his driver a very good feeling for the road. The BMW 235i RS has a great rear wheel performance and the Porsche Cayman GTS with its mid-engine puts a smile on your face as soon as you put your foot on the accelerator.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: With the creation of its i8, Munich-based car manufacturer BMW makes a big step towards the future. After all, the futuristic looking car is the first German sports car which utilizes hybrid technology. Supercars checks out the BMW i8 on the streets of Los Angeles. But BMW did not just work on the i8. They also present the new sports coupe 435i and the sporty SUV X550d M.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: If you have only sat in the back of a big limousine and if you don't know how much these kind of limousines are, you are probably part of the management. When it comes to driving experience and performance, it makes sense that the driver¿s seat is less attractive. But that's only the case for seasoned state cars anyways. The Audi RS and Mercedes S-Class might even make some chauffeurs unemployed.

programme.title: McLaren 570 GT
programme.desc: Onboard the McLaren 570 GT on the island of Tenerife

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Since the 1950s, the Mercedes-Benz SL has been regarded as the sports car legend par excellence. Beginning with the legendary 300 SL with its gullwing doors, the SL series stands for innovation and cultivated sportiness.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang is the icon of all sports coupes and convertibles - no other car conveys so much the lifestyle of the 1960s. With its striking shape and powerful engines the Mustang drove itself into the hearts of millions.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Beatles, Peter Sellers, Britt Ekland or the British royals, they all drove the Austin Mini. Designed on a napkin, the Mini starts an incredible career in 1959: the revolutionary Mini is considered the prototype of all small cars.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: A car that everyone knows and that almost everyone has ridden in, a car that has conquered all continents and bears an unmistakable nickname, the Volkswagen Beetle.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Ferrari - the name alone raises the pulse. No other sports car has as much magic and myth as the fiery red icons from Maranello. Whether on the road or on the race track, these cars are the centre of attention.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Saab 93 and Saab 99 Turbo
programme.desc: In 1937 an airplane manufacturing company was founded in Sweden that later became the famous car manufacturer Saab. We present two of their iconic car models, the Saab 93 and 99 Turbo.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Normal is not enough. Tuning is a way of life for many car fans - the search for ever more horsepower, better sound and extraordinary design.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The Monza Rally Show is a classic among drift shows. Plus: a Mercedes G-Class becomes a special off-roader 'ORC Bull'. And: a Mini Countryman becomes a Dakar Rally competitor.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Porsche is like a religion! The faiths: Punk, technology and racing. Porsche punk Magnus Walker preaches individualism for historic vehicles. Technology has been embodied by Alois RUF since 1983. And for the racers, there is the GT3 RS.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: BMW tries to combine the electric future with fuel-saving features in the i8. In addition: the 'Race Chip' is tested on a 3,000-kilometre route. And: What is the benefit of the switchable performance enhancement from DTE Systems?

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: They are the US car icons par excellence: Chevy, Ford Mustang and Corvette. At Race 61, fans of historic racers pay homage to their heroes. And: we explore the history of the Ford Mustang up to the current model.
